titles.title: First Higher Education Extension Act of 2007
First Higher Education Extension Act of 2007
To temporarily extend the programs under the Higher Education Act of 1965, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.
Mr. Hinojosa moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2559.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
Star Print ordered on the bill.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Higher Education, Lifelong Learning, and Competitiveness.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and Labor

committee.subcommittee: Higher Education, Lifelong Learning, and Competitiveness
committee.name: House Education and Labor
Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary: 6/6/2007--Passed House without amendment. First Higher Education Extension Act of 2007 - Amends the Higher Education Extension Act of 2005 to extend the programs under the Higher Education Act of 1965 through October 31, 2007.
